thread.title: Harmony of Seas will include Royal Caribbean's first water park for kids
thread.title_full: Harmony of Seas will include Royal Caribbean's first water park for kids

author: Arlene Satchell
title: Harmony of Seas will include Royal Caribbean's first water park for kids
text:
Harmony of Seas will include Royal Caribbean's first water park for kids Splashaway Bay illustration Royal Caribbean International 
Royal Caribbean International's new Harmony of the Seas cruise ship will be the first in its fleet to feature Splashaway Bay an interactive aqua park for kids. 

Royal Caribbean International's new Harmony of the Seas cruise ship will be the first in its fleet to feature Splashaway Bay an interactive aqua park for kids. 
World's largest cruise ship heading to Port Everglades in November 2016 Harmony of the Seas will have 2,747 cabins and span 16 guest decks 
New Oasis-class ship to also offer Ultimate Abyss, the tallest slide at sea 8 
The world's largest cruise ship, headed to Port Everglades in November 2016, will be the first Royal Caribbean ship with a new water park for kids, 
The new 5,497-passenger Harmony of the Seas also will feature the tallest water slide at sea with a 100-foot plunge and a trio of slides known as The Perfect Storm, Royal Caribbean said in a news release. Caption The Perfect Storm on Harmony of the Seas Royal Caribbean International 
The Perfect Storm is a trio of slides coming to Harmony of the Seas. The three slide names are Cyclone, Typhoon and Supercell. 
The Perfect Storm is a trio of slides coming to Harmony of the Seas. The three slide names are Cyclone, Typhoon and Supercell. (Royal Caribbean International) Caption The Perfect Storm on Harmony of the Seas Royal Caribbean International 
The Perfect Storm is a trio of slides coming to Harmony of the Seas. The three slide names are Cyclone, Typhoon and Supercell. 
The Perfect Storm is a trio of slides coming to Harmony of the Seas. The three slide names are Cyclone, Typhoon and Supercell. (Royal Caribbean International) See more galleries 
At 227,000 gross registered tons, Harmony of the Seas will have 2,747 cabins and span 16 decks. The ship will debut in May 2016 in Europe for a series of seven-night Western Mediterranean itineraries before moving to its homeport in Fort Lauderdale for seven-night sailings to the Eastern and Western Caribbean. 
Similar to Oasis of the Seas and Allure of the Seas, Harmony will offer seven neighborhoods such as Central Park, Boardwalk and the Royal Promenade as well as a spa and fitness center. 
The water park, called Splashaway Bay, will include sea creature water cannons, winding slides, a gigantic drench bucket and a multiplatform jungle gym, the Miami-based cruise line said.
